hero.headline: AI-Powered Document Processing for Mass Tort Litigation
hero.subheadline: Mass tort cases demand consistency across thousands of claimant files. Dodonai processes medical records, deposition transcripts, and supporting documents at scale — delivering uniform summaries and chronologies for every plaintiff so your team can focus on case strategy, not paperwork.

sections.heading: Why Mass Tort Firms Need AI Document Processing
paragraphs: Mass tort litigation is defined by volume and the need for consistency across it. Whether you are managing an MDL with thousands of claimants, running a state-court consolidation, or building your firm's case inventory for a developing litigation, every plaintiff needs the same level of documentation: organized medical records, completed plaintiff fact sheets, and a damages profile your team can use for triage and settlement modeling.

Traditional approaches do not scale to MDL volumes. Hiring additional paralegals, outsourcing to record review vendors at $5 to $15 per page, or relying on contract attorneys all introduce bottlenecks and inconsistencies. When the PSC sets a plaintiff fact sheet deadline or the transferee court orders a case census, you need to process hundreds of claimant files on the same timeline — not wait months for manual review to trickle in.

AI document processing changes the economics. Dodonai's platform ingests medical records in bulk, generates {{link:/ai-medical-record-summaries-chronologies/|medical chronologies and summaries}} for each claimant, and delivers consistent, structured outputs your team can use immediately for PFS completion, bellwether selection, settlement grid stratification, and trial preparation. The AI handles scanned and handwritten records through built-in {{link:/ai-pdf-ocr/|OCR}}, so records from any provider are processed without manual preprocessing.

Dodonai is SOC 2 Type II certified and HIPAA compliant, which means protected health information across all claimant files is handled with enterprise-grade security. Your data is encrypted with AES-256, never used to train AI models, and subject to your full control over retention and deletion.

cards.title: Bulk Record Processing at Scale
cards.description: Upload and process medical records for hundreds or thousands of claimants simultaneously. Dodonai handles the volume that mass tort cases demand without sacrificing the quality or detail of individual claimant summaries.

cards.title: Consistent Outputs Across All Plaintiffs
cards.description: Every claimant receives the same structured chronology and summary format, eliminating the variability that creeps in when different reviewers process records manually. Consistent outputs are essential when the court requires standardized plaintiff fact sheets, when you are stratifying claims for a settlement grid, or when selecting bellwether plaintiffs for early trial.

cards.title: Medical Chronologies with Source Citations
cards.description: Each claimant's medical chronology includes dates, providers, diagnoses, treatments, and outcomes — all linked back to the source page in the original records. Attorneys and paralegals can verify any data point without searching through raw files.

cards.title: AI OCR for Scanned and Handwritten Records
cards.description: Mass tort record sets frequently include scanned faxes, handwritten physician notes, and low-quality copies from dozens of different providers. Dodonai's {{link:/ai-pdf-ocr/|AI-powered OCR}} extracts text from these documents so nothing is missed during processing.

cards.title: Dramatically Lower Per-Claimant Costs
cards.description: Traditional medical record review costs $5 to $15 per page. At scale, that means hundreds of thousands of dollars just in document review for a single mass tort. Dodonai's credit-based pricing reduces per-claimant costs to a fraction of outsourced services.

cards.title: Faster Case Evaluation and Triage
cards.description: Get claimant summaries in minutes rather than weeks. Faster processing means your team can triage incoming cases, identify claimants with the strongest specific causation evidence, prioritize bellwether candidates, and respond to CMO deadlines without waiting on outsourced review timelines.

items.title: Upload Claimant Records in Bulk
items.description: Upload medical records for individual claimants or entire plaintiff groups to Dodonai's secure platform. The system accepts PDFs of any size, including scanned and image-based documents, and requires no formatting or preprocessing before upload.

items.title: AI Generates Summaries and Chronologies
items.description: Dodonai's AI processes each claimant's records, extracts key medical events — diagnoses, treatments, surgeries, medications, provider visits — and organizes everything into structured chronologies and narrative summaries. You can specify key topics or conditions to guide the AI's focus for your specific mass tort.

items.title: Review, Export, and Integrate into Your Workflow
items.description: Review outputs in the interactive viewer with side-by-side source linking. Export finished summaries and chronologies as PDF, Word, or Excel files. Use the structured data for plaintiff fact sheet completion, case census reporting, settlement grid stratification, bellwether selection, and trial preparation binders.

sections.heading: Mass Tort Document Processing: Dodonai vs. Manual Review at Scale

faq.question: Can Dodonai handle the volume of records in a mass tort case?
faq.answer: Yes. Dodonai is built for MDL-scale volumes. You can upload and process medical records for hundreds or thousands of claimants, and the platform scales without degrading output quality. Each claimant receives the same structured chronology and summary — the kind of consistency you need when completing plaintiff fact sheets, meeting CMO deadlines, or building a case census across your entire inventory.

faq.question: How does Dodonai ensure consistency across thousands of claimant summaries?
faq.answer: Because the same AI model processes every record set using the same extraction logic, the output format and level of detail are consistent across all plaintiffs. This eliminates the variability that occurs when different paralegals or outsourced reviewers apply their own judgment to each file.

faq.question: What does mass tort document processing cost with Dodonai?
faq.answer: Dodonai uses a credit-based pricing model where 1 credit equals approximately 1 page. Per-page costs range from $0.15 on the Lite plan down to $0.02 on the Pro plan. For mass tort volumes, Enterprise pricing with custom credit allocations is available. Compare that to $5 to $15 per page from traditional record review vendors — at MDL scale, the difference can be hundreds of thousands of dollars across your case inventory.

faq.question: Can I process records from different providers for the same claimant?
faq.answer: Yes. You can upload records from multiple healthcare providers for a single claimant, and Dodonai will extract and organize the information into a unified {{link:/ai-medical-record-summaries-chronologies/|medical chronology}}. The interactive viewer lets you filter entries by provider, date range, or event type.

faq.question: Is Dodonai secure enough for mass tort medical records?
faq.answer: Dodonai is HIPAA compliant with signed Business Associate Agreements and SOC 2 Type II certified. All data is encrypted with AES-256 in transit and at rest. Your claimant data is never used to train AI models, and you retain full control over data retention and deletion policies.

faq.question: How does Dodonai handle scanned records from older medical providers?
faq.answer: Mass tort cases often involve records from dozens of different providers, many of which deliver scanned PDFs, faxed copies, or documents with handwritten notes. Dodonai includes built-in {{link:/ai-pdf-ocr/|AI-powered OCR}} that extracts text from these documents automatically. You do not need to run records through a separate OCR tool before uploading.
